citation:Description.dsDescription:Text: The objective of this Canadian multi-centre pragmatic randomized controlled trial was to compare the effectiveness of the new single-incision device, Gynecare TVT Secur, to the established predecate retropubic TVT device, in terms of objective cure of stress urinary incontinence (SUI) at 12 months postoperatively. Other outcomes included: complications, symptoms, and incontinence-related quality of life.

geospatial:Geographic Coverage.geographicCoverage:Other: Calgary, Alberta; Edmonton, Alberta; Vancouver, British Columbia; Penticton, British Columbia

Grant Information.grantNumber:Grant Agency: Johnson & Johnson Medical Companies; Alberta Health Services; Women's and Children's Health Research Institute (WCHRI)

Related Publication.Citation: Ross S, Tang S, Schulz J, et al. Single incision device (TVT Secur) versus retropubic tension-free vaginal tape device (TVT) for the management of stress urinary incontinence in women: a randomized clinical trial. BMC Research Notes. 2014;7:941.

ore:describes.socialscience:Actions to Minimize Losses: Emails were sent out two months before the year follow-up to schedule the appointment and reminders were sent one month before the appointment. If the participant was unable to come in person, questionnaires were sent by mail. Additional contacts were collected for study participants in the event that they were hard to reach or had moved.
ore:describes.Alternative Title: Tension-free Vaginal Tape Management of Stress Incontinence in Women: Randomized Trial of TVT Secur Versus TVT
ore:describes.citation:Production Place: Calgary, Alberta; Edmonton, Alberta; Penticton, British Columbia; Vancouver, British Columbia
ore:describes.Data Sources: Urogenital Distress Inventory (UDI-6); Incontinence Impact Questionnaire (IIQ-7); the Pelvic Organ Prolapse/Urinary Incontinence Sexual Questionnaire-12, (PISQ-12); the 15D Instrument of Health-related Quality of Life (15D) was included for the proposed economic evaluation which was never done.
ore:describes.socialscience:Universe: Women with stress incontinence, defined as leaking with increased abdominal pressure.
ore:describes.Subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
ore:describes.socialscience:Sampling Procedure: The sample size estimate for our trial was 300, but the trial stopped early because of poor recruitment. 74 women participated (40 allocated to TVT Secur, 34 to TVT). Data was collected and analysed for 33/40 (83%) of the TVT Secur group and 28/34 (89%) of the TVT group.
ore:describes.citation:Related Material: Ross S, Robert M, Ducey A.  The short life cycle of a surgical device - literature analysis using McKinlay's 7-stage model.  Health Policy Technol. 2015 Feb 23;4:168-188.
ore:describes.socialscience:Collection Mode: Self-administered questionnaire: Paper; Self-administered writings and/or diaries; Physical measurements and tests; Chart review
ore:describes.socialscience:Characteristics of Data Co: The trial ended early because of poor recruitment.
ore:describes.socialscience:Cleaning Operations: The data entry clerk entered data, and the statistician and data entry clerk checked over all data before analysis. Data was checked for outliers, and range and logic checks were performed. Paper forms were kept and were compared to electronic records in the event of missing or outlying data.
ore:describes.socialscience:Frequency: Data was collected at baseline and one year postoperative.
ore:describes.Title: Single Incision Device (TVT Secur) Versus Retropubic Tension-free Vaginal Tape Device (TVT) for the Management of Stress Urinary Incontinence in Women: A Randomized Clinical Trial
ore:describes.schema:name: Single Incision Device (TVT Secur) Versus Retropubic Tension-free Vaginal Tape Device (TVT) for the Management of Stress Urinary Incontinence in Women: A Randomized Clinical Trial
ore:describes.dvcore:conditions: Access to deidentified data may be permitted for external researchers, with limitations. Only researchers with REB-approved projects may be permitted access to the deidentified data. The data producer determines access on a case-by-case basis. Contact the data producer directly to discuss terms and conditions of access.

dvcore:fileTermsOfAccess.dvcore:dataAccessPlace: Paper copies are archived at Iron Mountain. Electronic database is hosted on a server at the University of Calgary.

ore:describes.schema:includedInDataCatalog: Women and Children's Health Research Institute (WCHRI)
